meanings.definition: An optical instrument with two eyepieces used to view two-dimensional images in three dimensions.
meanings.sent1: I looked through the stereoscope and saw the picture pop out in 3D.
meanings.sent2: She peered into the stereoscope to see the photo in 3D.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to look through the stereoscope, thinking it was a window to another world.
meanings.sent4: His mind acted like a stereoscope, bringing depth to the flat story.
meanings.sent5: Using the stereoscope made the image come alive before my eyes.

meanings.definition: A device for producing or viewing stereoscopic photographs.
meanings.sent1: The photographer used a stereoscope to create amazing 3D pictures.
meanings.sent2: They marveled at the old stereoscope displaying historical photos.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the stereoscope was a magical camera that could capture dreams.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes became like a stereoscope, seeing the world in a new dimension.
meanings.sent5: The stereoscope revealed hidden details in the photograph.
